result.execSummary:
The defendant Russell J. DeCamp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs, service fees and DNA surcharge

Not allowed to vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.  No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No contact with known drug users or sellers except in a treatment setting and only with prior agent approval.
Provide DNA sample by 8-29-2022.  AODA assessment and follow through.  Assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by the agent.

timeConds.notes: No good time, credit for 158 days and Huber release if in compliance with jail rules and regulations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
